summary: A letter of support for Ghislaine Maxwell's renewed bail application written by Katie Vaughan-Edwards, a long-time friend and former employee. The letter describes their 32-year friendship, Maxwell's character, her family life, and the intense media pressure and safety fears Maxwell faced following Jeffrey Epstein's death.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the bail application and the letter of support. Described as a long-time friend, employer, stepmother, and charity director facing criminal charges.

persons.name: Katie Vaughan-Edwards
persons.context: Author of the support letter. First employed by Maxwell in 1988, remained a close friend, served as a Director of The TerraMar Charity, and manages Maxwell's London house.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell to whom the letter is addressed.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to Maxwell's 'past connection' and the ramping up of press interest following his death in August 2019.

connections.description: Vaughan-Edwards was employed by Maxwell at Maxwell's Corporate Gifts in London in 1988.
Remained close friends for 32 years, with regular contact, mutual visits, and stays at each other's homes.
Vaughan-Edwards served as a Director and Trustee of Maxwell's charity, The TerraMar Charity, and allowed her home to be its registered address.
Described as Maxwell's 'past connection' to Epstein, which is the source of the allegations against her.

events.title: Employment Begins
events.description: Katie Vaughan-Edwards first met and was employed by Ghislaine Maxwell at Maxwell's Corporate Gifts in London.

events.title: Father's Death and Stay in NY
events.description: Vaughan-Edwards stayed with Maxwell in her New York apartment immediately after the death of Maxwell's father.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Epstein's death caused a 'tremendous ramping of press interest' in Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Visit During Hiding
events.description: Katie Vaughan-Edwards spent a couple of days and nights with Ghislaine Maxwell while Maxwell was in hiding, experiencing firsthand her fear of press and bounty hunters.

events.title: Bail Support Letter Submitted
events.description: Katie Vaughan-Edwards submits a confidential letter of support to Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's renewed bail application.

keyFacts: The author, Katie Vaughan-Edwards, has known Ghislaine Maxwell for 32 years, first as an employee in 1988 and later as a close friend and charity director.
Vaughan-Edwards allowed her teenage daughter to stay with Maxwell in the US and UK and states Maxwell has been a great support to all her children.

Following Jeffrey Epstein's death in August 2019, Maxwell faced intense media pressure, including a bounty offered by a UK newspaper (The Sun), leading her to go into hiding out of fear for her safety and to protect her family.
The TerraMar Charity, for which Vaughan-Edwards was a Trustee, was investigated by the Charity Commission but no wrongdoing was found; it was dissolved due to media pressure connected to Maxwell.
The letter is intended to support Maxwell's renewed bail application, arguing she is not a flight risk and will attend trial to clear her name if released.
